Html:
I have just discovered that there is an error in the two IEEE styles, IEEE_Reference.XSL and IEEE_Alphabetical.XSL. The error is in the format for the type Report which is shown here:

<source type="Report">
        <column id="1">
          <halign>right</halign>
          <valign>top</valign>
          <format>{[%RefOrder%]}</format>
        </column>
        <column id="2">
          <halign>left</halign>
          <valign>top</valign>
          <format>{%Author:1%, }{"%Title%," }{%Departement%, }{%Institution%, }{%City|StateProvince|CountryRegion%, }{%StateProvince|CountryRegion%, }{%CountryRegion%, }{%ThesisType% }{%StandardNumber%, }{{%Month:s%{ %Day%,}} %Year%}.{ [Online]. %URL:l%}</format>
        </column>
        <sortkey></sortkey>
      </source>

The error is the misspelling or typing error for the parameter %Department%. It has been spelt %Departement% which makes it to fail. I have not checked if this error also appears in some of the other styles.

Frode
That is indeed a typing error. It also occurs in the Vancouver style. I will fix them. Thanks for reporting.
